system.title: System
system.autoStartEnabledDesc: Eclipse will start with Windows in the background.
system.autoStartDisabledDesc: Eclipse will no longer start automatically.

intro.title: Welcome to Eclipse
intro.description: Eclipse is the control panel that Sunshine should have had.
intro.paragraph1: lets you stream a dedicated screen from your PC to a TV, smartphone, or any device with
intro.paragraph2: It's like plugging in a virtual HDMI cable: the streamed screen is a real additional display with its own behavior, that you can use as you see fit â€” without physical wires.
intro.paragraph3: In a single interface, Eclipse automatically configures the open-source tools Sunshine (streaming server) and VDD (virtual display) for you.

diagram.title: How it works
diagram.sunshineDesc: The streaming server. It captures the virtual screen and sends it over the local network.
diagram.vddDesc: Creates a virtual display dedicated to streaming, without monopolizing your main monitor.
diagram.moonlightDesc: The client app (TV, phone, tablet, Steam Deck, Xbox...) that receives the stream and lets you use your own peripherals: controller, keyboard, mouse.
diagram.mmtDesc: A NirSoft utility that lets Eclipse automatically detect and manage your displays (resolution, activation, identification).

presets.title: Presets Guide
presets.step1Screen: Settings â†’ Screen Management â†’ "+ Create Preset"
presets.step2Screen: Choose a name, a resolution (e.g.: 1920x1080), and a refresh rate (e.g.: 60Hz).
presets.step3Screen: Click on the preset to activate it. The virtual screen turns on with the chosen configuration.
presets.tipScreen: Create different presets for different devices: 4K for TV, 1080p for tablet, etc.
presets.step1Config: Settings â†’ Sunshine Configuration â†’ "+ Create Preset"
presets.screenOption: Screen â€” automatically enable a screen preset on launch
presets.step3Config: Click on the preset to activate it. Sunshine restarts with the new configuration.
presets.autoTip: Tip: If you chose a screen preset and the Enabled mode in the configuration, the virtual screen will activate automatically when the stream starts!

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: Why doesn't my screen show up on Moonlight?
faq.a1: Check that the correct Sunshine configuration is active (light indicator in Settings â†’ Sunshine Configuration). If the problem persists, verify that Moonlight is connected to the same network as your PC.
faq.q2: Why won't my virtual screen turn on?
faq.a2: Check that the screen preset is activated (green indicator) in Settings â†’ Screen Management. If the problem persists, click "Refresh" to restart VDD driver detection.
faq.q3: How do I make the screen turn on automatically when streaming starts?
faq.a3: In Settings â†’ Sunshine Configuration, create or edit a preset, select a screen preset and choose the "Enabled" mode. When this Sunshine preset is active, the virtual screen will turn on automatically when the stream starts.
faq.q4: How do I change the stream quality?
faq.a4: Quality settings (FPS, bitrate) are configured in Sunshine presets (Settings â†’ Sunshine Configuration). You can also access advanced settings via the "Open Advanced Sunshine" button below.
faq.q5: The virtual screen is created but Sunshine doesn't see it?
faq.a5: Use the "Refresh" button in Settings â†’ Screen Management to refresh the Device ID. The VDD driver will briefly turn on to detect the correct identifier.
faq.moreQuestions: More questions? Join the Eclipse Discord via

network.firewallAdvice: Restart Eclipse as administrator to recreate it
network.sunshineReachableNo: Sunshine is not responding on port 47990

sunshineMissing.title: Sunshine seems missing

sunshineMissing.successDesc: Sunshine has been reinstalled successfully. The application will restart...
sunshineMissing.solutionText: Reinstall Eclipse from the official website or contact support on Discord.
